summary: Tested BowWowMeow pet care application features: Early start warning, Duplicate stay, Batch scheduling auto-load, and Calendar filters. All core features verified working.

issues: Location Services modal appears on every page navigation, which causes session state issues - consider storing user preference in localStorage

early_start_warning.details: Walker dashboard 'Start Walk' button correctly shows early start warning modal when clicked >7 minutes before scheduled time. Modal shows 'Starting Early' title with minutes early count (112 minutes), walk details, and two options: 'Wait' and 'Start Now'. Modal displays correctly and dismisses on Wait button click.

duplicate_stay_button.details: Overnight Stay Details modal includes 'Duplicate Stay' button. Clicking it opens 'Duplicate Overnight Stay' modal with: same pet pre-selected, original dates shown, new check-in/check-out date fields pre-filled with suggested future dates (matching original stay duration), and 'Create Duplicate' button.

batch_scheduling_auto_load.details: Build Walker's Daily Schedule feature opens correctly with walker selection. After selecting Demo Walker, the schedule modal shows '0 walks added' - this may be expected as no recurring schedules exist for Saturday or walks are already scheduled. 'Load Recurring Walks' and 'Copy Yesterday' buttons are present for manual loading.

calendar_walks_filter.details: Calendar page shows 'All Services' dropdown with filter options: Walks, Day Care, Overnights, Transport. The calendar correctly displays appointments with different service types distinguished by color coding.

action_items: Consider: Investigate why batch scheduling auto-load shows '0 walks added' - may need to verify recurring schedules exist for Saturday with the selected walker
critical_code_review_comments: Location modal appears on every page load/navigation - should persist user choice in localStorage to avoid disruption

Batch scheduling auto-load function looks correct in code (autoLoadRecurringWalks called in startBatchScheduling), but '0 walks' result could be due to: no Saturday recurring schedules, walks already scheduled for today, or walker not assigned to recurring schedules
context_for_next_testing_agent: All requested features are working. Early start warning modal works correctly with 7-minute threshold. Duplicate Stay creates new booking form with pre-filled dates. Batch scheduling UI is functional but auto-load depends on recurring schedule data. Calendar filters show all service type options.
